{{cpp/experimental/fs/title|temp_directory_path}}
{{cpp/experimental/fs/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|experimental/filesystem}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=fs_ts|1=
path temp_directory_path();
path temp_directory_path( error_code&amp; ec );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns the directory location suitable for temporary files.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A directory suitable for temporary files. The path is guaranteed to exist and to be a directory. The overload that takes {{tt|error_code&amp;}} argument returns an empty path on error.

===Exceptions===
{{cpp/experimental/fs/error_handling|path to be returned}}

===Notes===
On POSIX systems, the path may be the one specified in the environment variables {{tt|TMPDIR}}, {{tt|TMP}}, {{tt|TEMP}}, {{tt|TEMPDIR}}, and, if none of them are specified, the path {{c|"/tmp"}} is returned. 

On Windows systems, the path is typically the one returned by {{tt|GetTempPath}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;experimental/filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
namespace fs = std::experimental::filesystem;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Temp directory is " &lt;&lt; fs::temp_directory_path() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
Temp directory is "C:\Windows\TEMP\"
}}
